ANN ARBOR
WHOM 91.7 M.C.
FLINT WFUM 107.1 M.C.
UNIVERSITY OF MICHIGAN WALDO ABBOT. DIRECTOR OF BROADCASTING
ANN ARBOR. MICH. E. G. burrows, program director
January 13, 1956
Mr. John Holt, Manager
NAEB Tape Network
Gregory Ha I I
Urbana, Illinois
Dear John:
RECEIVED
NAEB HEADQUARTERS
JAN 1 C 1953
AM PIW
7|8|9|1?|11|12|1|?,3|4|5i?
i
As I understood it, I was not supposed to be
voting upon the submissions. However, from my reports
that I get upon the votes it does not seem that I am
getting very many. Mix and Slack seem to be very loyal
and efficient in sending in their votes. Just in case
you need some more, I would cast my vote "no" for The
Playroom. I did not find the tape interesting or well
produced. I tried it upon my grandchildren and they
wouldn’t listen to it. I cast my vote "yes" for The
Fourth R. It is well produced, it is an interesting
show, but I don’t think it is highly educational and
probably has less appeal for the adult audience than
for a youthful audience.
I have sample tapes for Britain Today, The
Child Beyond, Patterns of Thought, and a tape on the
United States college education. Do you wish me to
submit votes for these programs in order to break and
speed up acceptance or rejection?
Cordially yours.
Wa I do Abbot
Director of Broadcasting
